title: Plates in circuits W and X

content.question: The figures above show two circuits with identical batteries, resistors, and capacitors. The circuits have reached a steady state. Which of the following is true about the charge <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> on the capacitor plates to which the arrows point?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q X is less than Q W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Q X is greater than Q W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
The charges on the plates cannot be compared without knowing the values of the resistance and capacitance.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
